intro: Navicularia syriaca subsp. catillaris, commonly known as the Syrian navicula, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Aizoaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers. Native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East, this species is adapted to hot, dry climates. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its unique morphology and resilience make it a notable species in xerophytic plant communities.
